Articles.Content: Anyone know any good/fun free games? I need something to play between KSP releases.

pioneer space sim,its a fun free game

its set in the 31st century and its still in alpha so there will be bugs but none that will ruin the fun of the game

http://pioneerspacesim.net/

you can see me old thread if you want more description

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=2298.msg21982#msg21982

Gang Garrison 2.

I have a server on it- \'Great British Server\'

Here\'s one...its not free, but you can\'t beat the buy in price:

Review here: http://www.simhq.com/_air14/air_511a.html
Team Fortress 2 is a great free game if you\'re interested in FPS. Other then that, I cannot think of any other titles that are free ... look\'s like majority of good games come with a price tag.

Team Fortress 2 is a great free game if you\'re interested in FPS. Other then that, I cannot think of any other titles that are free ... look\'s like majority of good games come with a price tag.

My friend told me about that. I\'m going to try it out but it takes forever to download.

My friend told me about that. I\'m going to try it out but it takes forever to download.

TF2 is epic. GG2 as I mentioned above is a 2d 8-bit version which works for my laptop.

Happy wheels.

Minecraft Classic

What

No

Classic isn\'t fun. Only official Minecraft is.

Gene Rally

http://gene-rally.com/

Shores Of Hazeron.

It will make your eyes bleed. But if you\'re a sci-fi fan, and didn\'t mind playing online games in the mid-late 1990s, then you\'ll love it.

Create an alien character, get dumped on some random world, make simple tools and survive, found a town and have people move in, build the town into a city, industrialise, electrify, build rockets and colonise the star-system, design and build spaceships go out and explore the galaxyâ€¦ maybe accidently stumble across some other playerâ€™s empire in amongst the millions of star systems, go to war with them, join them, trade with them, doesnâ€™t really matter.

When I first started playing I killed the tutorial guy who showed up to teach me how to move around, what the UI did, and how to make a simple flaming torch. I beat him to death with the torch... and then ate him. Used his skin to make my first cityâ€™s founding-flag, I seem to remember.

The lag is evil, i\'d still be playing it now if it didn\'t lag quite so bad.

NITRONIC RUSH

Is epic survival racing game.
im downloading pionneer-alpha17.7 and it looks fun i want to work for nasa i want to make things that will take humans to mars or even longer then mars far out to space

Just because I joined in 1.7.3. >_>

Just because I joined in 1.7.3. >_>

Yeah, that\'s young. I may not have been there the whole time, but I\'ve played since beta came out.
>obligatory 'minecraft isn\'t fun anymore' comment from yours truly.
I\'ve been playing since beta 1.3. I agree that single player isn\'t fun anymore but I still like to play multiplayer with my friends.

It isn\'t fun when you know what everything does. I started playing in alpha 1.2.2. I can remember how fun it was, doing everything for the first time, in a land of mysteries. I didn\'t know anything, and that\'s what made it fun. But then I read all the guides and learned what everything did, and Minecraft lost its mystery. It wasn\'t fun. The introduction of reliable multiplayer fixed this for a while, as did my discovery of mods. but by beta 1.7.3 I was done. So I waited until release, and I stopped reading anything about it, so the new things would be a mystery. And it worked. Minecraft is fun again for me. So yeah, wait like six months without doing anything Minecraft related and it is fun again.
6 months? Try 11.
